Type.Name: Accelerator

TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Accelerator extends System.Object

Type.ThreadSafetyStatement: Gtk# is thread aware, but not thread safe; See the Gtk# Thread Programming for details.

Docs.remarks: TODO: explain the relationship between this class and .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed
public static Gdk.ModifierType DefaultModMask { get; set; }

Docs.summary: A mask to specify the default modifier key(s).

MemberSignature.Value: public static string GetLabel (uint accelerator_key, Gdk.ModifierType accelerator_mods);
.method public static hidebysig string GetLabel(unsigned int32 accelerator_key, valuetype Gdk.ModifierType accelerator_mods) cil managed

Docs.param: A representing the accelerator modifier mask.
Docs.summary: Converts an accelerator keyval and modifier mask into a string which can be used to represent the accelerator to the user.
Docs.returns: A newly-allocated string representing the accelerator.

MemberSignature.Value: public static string Name (uint accelerator_key, Gdk.ModifierType accelerator_mods);
.method public static hidebysig string Name(unsigned int32 accelerator_key, valuetype Gdk.ModifierType accelerator_mods) cil managed

Docs.summary: Converts an accelerator keyval and modifier mask into a string parseable by . For example, if you pass in and , this function returns "<Control>q".
Docs.remarks: In Gtk+, the return value must be freed by the caller, but not in Gtk#.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void Parse (string accelerator, out uint accelerator_key, out Gdk.ModifierType accelerator_mods);
.method public static hidebysig void Parse(string accelerator, unsigned int32 accelerator_key, valuetype Gdk.ModifierType accelerator_mods) cil managed

Docs.summary: Parses a string representing an accelerator. The format looks like "<Control>a" or "<Shift><Alt>F1" or "<Release>z" (the last one is for key release). The parser is fairly liberal and allows lower or upper case, and also abbreviations such as "<Ctl>" and "<Ctrl>".
Docs.remarks: If the parse fails, and will be set to 0 (zero).

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool Valid (uint keyval, Gdk.ModifierType modifiers);
.method public static hidebysig bool Valid(unsigned int32 keyval, valuetype Gdk.ModifierType modifiers) cil managed

Docs.summary: Determines whether a given keyval and modifier mask constitute a valid keyboard accelerator. For example, keyval plus is valid; this is a "Ctrl+a" accelerator. However, you can't use the keyval as an accelerator.
